required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Individualized vs. Household Eradication of MRSA in Households With Children

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research study is to compare the effectiveness of commonly used decolonization treatments (application of mupirocin antibiotic ointment to the nose and bleach baths) when performed by individuals with a history of skin and soft tissue infection (SSTI) in the prior year (individualized approach) in comparison to decolonization of all household members (household approach) in an attempt to prevent Staphylococcus aureus skin infections. The investigators hypothesize an individualized decolonization approach will be equally as effective as a household approach to prevent SSTI.

detailed_description.textblock:
Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) was once uniformly associated with hospital-acquired infections; however, MRSA strains have emerged that thrive outside the hospital environment, causing significant morbidity and mortality among immunocompetent individuals, leading to their designation as community-acquired methicillin resistant Staphylococcus aureus (CA-MRSA).
There is no available vaccine against S. aureus. Thus, other preventive measures, including topical antimicrobial therapies, have been used in an attempt to prevent staphylococcal infections. These therapies include mupirocin (a topical antibiotic with activity against MRSA) and dilute bleach water baths. The effectiveness of these measures directed at patients colonized with traditional MSSA and HA-MRSA strains in an attempt to prevent nosocomial infections varies across studies, and maintenance of eradication diminishes over time. With the emergence of the CA-MRSA epidemic, these measures have been extrapolated to patients in community settings. We aim to find a practical approach to decolonization which patients can feasibly perform at home to reduce the incidence of skin and soft tissue infections(SSTI).
Specific Aim: Compare the effectiveness of decolonization of individuals with a history of SSTI in the prior year (individualized approach) to decolonization of all household members (household approach) in reducing the incidence of recurrent SSTI. Primary hypothesis: An individualized decolonization approach will be equally as effective as decolonization of all household members to prevent SSTI. Secondary hypothesis: Application of mupirocin to the anterior nares twice daily for 5 days will not result in a higher prevalence of colonization with mupirocin-resistant strains at subsequent longitudinal samplings.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Incidence of SSTI at 3 Months After Decolonization
primary_outcome.description: Cumulative Number of Participants with SSTI at any time during the 3 Months following Decolonization protocol

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Incidence of SSTI at 1 Month After Decolonization
secondary_outcome.description: Cumulative Number of Participants with SSTI at any time during the 1 Month following Decolonization protocol

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Incidence of SSTI at 6 Months After Decolonization
secondary_outcome.description: Cumulative Number of Participants with SSTI at any time during the 6 Months following Decolonization protocol

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Incidence of SSTI at 9 Months After Decolonization
secondary_outcome.description: Cumulative Number of Participants with SSTI at any time during the 9 Months following Decolonization protocol

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Incidence of SSTI at 12 Months After Decolonization
secondary_outcome.description: Cumulative Number of Participants with SSTI at any time during the 12 Months following Decolonization protocol

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Colonized With MRSA at 1 Month After Decolonization
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants Colonized with MRSA at the 1 Month longitudinal study visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Colonized With MRSA at 3 Months After Decolonization
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants Colonized with MRSA at the 3 Month longitudinal study visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Colonized With MRSA at 6 Months After Decolonization
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants Colonized with MRSA at the 6 Month longitudinal study visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Colonized With MRSA at 9 Months After Decolonization
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants Colonized with MRSA at the 9 Month longitudinal study visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Colonized With MRSA at 12 Months After Decolonization
secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants Colonized with MRSA at the 12 Month longitudinal study visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Report Development of Adverse Effects Occurring During Decolonization Period
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants who report development of Nasal burning, itching, stinging, or runny nose or Skin itching, dry skin, or rash during the decolonization period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of All Recovered S. Aureus Isolates With High-level Mupirocin Resistance
secondary_outcome.description: Number of all recovered S. aureus isolates resistant to mupirocin at the study visit before decolonization protocol and the study visit immediately after decolonization protocol

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Incurring Economic Burden of Performing Protocol
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants incurring additional costs during their compliance with prescribed hygiene measures prescribed with the decolonization regimen: e.g., cost of containers of lotion or bars of soap discarded, cost of new pump or pour lotion or soap purchased, cost of new personal hygiene items or linens, cost of additional loads of laundry

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Reporting a Confirmed MRSA Infection Over the 12-month Longitudinal Study Period.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants reporting the development of a MRSA infection over the year of longitudinal follow-up that has been culture- and physician-confirmed through verification by medical record and culture report.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Adhering to Decolonization Measures
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants Adhering to decolonization measures. Defined as reported completion of at least 4 of the 5 assigned days (8 or more mupirocin applications and 4 or more bleach baths)

arm_group.description: The decolonization regimen will be performed only by those household members who experienced SSTI in the prior year.
All members of the household will perform the decolonization regimen.

intervention.description: Participants over 1 month of age, apply ointment to the anterior nares twice daily for 5 days.
Participants over 1 month of age, pour 1/4 cup of bleach into a bath tub filled 1/4 full of water. Soak in bath for 15 minutes daily for 5 days.

Follow key hygiene tips: Throw out all lotions or creams that you dip your hands into and replace with pumps or pour bottles. Use liquid(pour or pump) soaps instead of bar soaps. Wash hands frequently or use hand sanitizer(with more than %60 alcohol) such as Germ-X or Purell. Do not share personal care items such as razors, brushes, or deodorant. Wash all sheets and towels in hot water. Wash sheets every week. Use towels and wash cloths only once before washing and do not share.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Individuals who are enrolled in a 12-month observational study entitled "The Community-Associated Methicillin-Resistant Staphylococcus aureus Among Household Members and the Home Environment Study."
Exclusion Criteria:
- Households in which all members experienced SSTI during the 12-month observational study
- Individuals with known allergies to mupirocin or bleach (sodium hypochlorite)

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Individualized Approach
group.description: The decolonization regimen will be performed only by those household members who experienced SSTI in the prior year. 2% mupirocin ointment: Participants over 1 month of age, apply ointment to the anterior nares twice daily for 5 days. Bleach Bath (dilute): Participants over 1 month of age, pour 1/4 cup of bleach into a bath tub filled 1/4 full of water. Soak in bath for 15 minutes daily for 5 days. Hygiene Protocol: Follow key hygiene tips: Throw out all lotions or creams that you dip your hands into and replace with pumps or pour bottles. Use liquid(pour or pump) soaps instead of bar soaps. Wash hands frequently or use hand sanitizer(with more than %60 alcohol) such as Germ-X or Purell. Do not share personal care items such as razors, brushes, or deodorant. Wash all sheets and towels in hot water. Wash sheets every week. Use towels and wash cloths only once before washing and do not share.

group.title: Household Approach
group.description: All members of the household will perform the decolonization regimen. 2% mupirocin ointment: Participants over 1 month of age, apply ointment to the anterior nares twice daily for 5 days. Bleach Bath (dilute): Participants over 1 month of age, pour 1/4 cup of bleach into a bath tub filled 1/4 full of water. Soak in bath for 15 minutes daily for 5 days. Hygiene Protocol: Follow key hygiene tips: Throw out all lotions or creams that you dip your hands into and replace with pumps or pour bottles. Use liquid(pour or pump) soaps instead of bar soaps. Wash hands frequently or use hand sanitizer(with more than %60 alcohol) such as Germ-X or Purell. Do not share personal care items such as razors, brushes, or deodorant. Wash all sheets and towels in hot water. Wash sheets every week. Use towels and wash cloths only once before washing and do not share.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Incidence of SSTI at 3 Months After Decolonization
outcome.description: Cumulative Number of Participants with SSTI at any time during the 3 Months following Decolonization protocol
outcome.population: 447 of 474 participants were analyzed. The remaining 27 participants were lost to follow up for this time frame.

Bleach Bath (dilute): Participants over 1 month of age, pour 1/4 cup of bleach into a bath tub filled 1/4 full of water. Soak in bath for 15 minutes daily for 5 days. Hygiene Protocol: Follow key hygiene tips: Throw out all lotions or creams that you dip your hands into and replace with pumps or pour bottles. Use liquid(pour or pump) soaps instead of bar soaps. Wash hands frequently or use hand sanitizer(with more than %60 alcohol) such as Germ-X or Purell. Do not share personal care items such as razors, brushes, or deodorant. Wash all sheets and towels in hot water. Wash sheets every week. Use towels and wash cloths only once before washing and do not share.

measure.title: Number of Participants Colonized With MRSA at 6 Months After Decolonization
measure.description: Number of Participants Colonized with MRSA at the 6 Month longitudinal study visit
measure.population: 431 of 474 participants were analyzed. The remaining 43 participants were lost to follow up for this time frame or were not available for swabs at the time of the home visit.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: testing non-inferiority of individualized approach compared to household approach.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: testing non-inferiority of individualized approach compared to household approach.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Report Development of Adverse Effects Occurring During Decolonization Period
outcome.description: Number of participants who report development of Nasal burning, itching, stinging, or runny nose or Skin itching, dry skin, or rash during the decolonization period.
outcome.population: 309 participants were assigned decolonization measures as part of the protocol. Of these 11 participants were lost to follow-up and never returned their adherence documents. 4 participants did not complete any part of the assigned decolonization measures. The remaining 294 participants are analyzed.

group.title: Individualized Approach
group.description: The decolonization regimen will be performed only by those household members who experienced SSTI in the prior year. 2% mupirocin ointment: Participants over 1 month of age, apply ointment to the anterior nares twice daily for 5 days. Bleach Bath (dilute): Participants over 1 month of age, pour 1/4 cup of bleach into a bath tub filled 1/4 full of water. Soak in bath for 15 minutes daily for 5 days. Hygiene Protocol: Follow key hygiene tips: Throw out all lotions or creams that you dip your hands into and replace with pumps or pour bottles. Use liquid(pour or pump) soaps instead of bar soaps. Wash hands frequently or use hand sanitizer(with more than %60 alcohol) such as Germ-X or Purell. Do not share personal care items such as razors, brushes, or deodorant. Wash all sheets and towels in hot water. Wash sheets every week. Use towels and wash cloths only once before washing and do not share.

group.description: All members of the household will perform the decolonization regimen. 2% mupirocin ointment: Participants over 1 month of age, apply ointment to the anterior nares twice daily for 5 days. Bleach Bath (dilute): Participants over 1 month of age, pour 1/4 cup of bleach into a bath tub filled 1/4 full of water. Soak in bath for 15 minutes daily for 5 days. Hygiene Protocol: Follow key hygiene tips: Throw out all lotions or creams that you dip your hands into and replace with pumps or pour bottles. Use liquid(pour or pump) soaps instead of bar soaps. Wash hands frequently or use hand sanitizer(with more than %60 alcohol) such as Germ-X or Purell. Do not share personal care items such as razors, brushes, or deodorant. Wash all sheets and towels in hot water. Wash sheets every week. Use towels and wash cloths only once before washing and do not share.

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Report Development of Adverse Effects Occurring During Decolonization Period
measure.description: Number of participants who report development of Nasal burning, itching, stinging, or runny nose or Skin itching, dry skin, or rash during the decolonization period.
measure.population: 309 participants were assigned decolonization measures as part of the protocol. Of these 11 participants were lost to follow-up and never returned their adherence documents. 4 participants did not complete any part of the assigned decolonization measures. The remaining 294 participants are analyzed.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: testing equivalence of individualized approach compared to household approach.

outcome.title: Number of All Recovered S. Aureus Isolates With High-level Mupirocin Resistance
outcome.description: Number of all recovered S. aureus isolates resistant to mupirocin at the study visit before decolonization protocol and the study visit immediately after decolonization protocol
outcome.population: All participants swabbed before decolonization. 438 participants swabbed at 1 mo. follow-up (after decolonization) - remaining 36 lost to follow-up or unavailable for swabs at home visit. This SECONDARY outcome is independent of study group, as the impact of the study on mupirocin resistance in overall study population is the outcome measure.

group.title: Before Decolonization
group.description: All isolates recovered across study before decolonization protocol began (enrollment visit)

group.title: After Decolonization
group.description: All isolates recovered across study directly after decolonization protocol (1 month visit)

measure.title: Number of All Recovered S. Aureus Isolates With High-level Mupirocin Resistance
measure.description: Number of all recovered S. aureus isolates resistant to mupirocin at the study visit before decolonization protocol and the study visit immediately after decolonization protocol
measure.population: All participants swabbed before decolonization. 438 participants swabbed at 1 mo. follow-up (after decolonization) - remaining 36 lost to follow-up or unavailable for swabs at home visit. This SECONDARY outcome is independent of study group, as the impact of the study on mupirocin resistance in overall study population is the outcome measure.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: testing equivalence of before and after decolonization protocol.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Incurring Economic Burden of Performing Protocol
outcome.description: Number of participants incurring additional costs during their compliance with prescribed hygiene measures prescribed with the decolonization regimen: e.g., cost of containers of lotion or bars of soap discarded, cost of new pump or pour lotion or soap purchased, cost of new personal hygiene items or linens, cost of additional loads of laundry
outcome.population: 435 of 474 participants returned their cost of protocol documentation. This SECONDARY outcome is independent of study group, as the economic impact of the study in the overall study population is the outcome measure.

group.title: Entire Study Population
group.description: Additional costs of associated with protocol across all participants

measure.title: Number of Participants Incurring Economic Burden of Performing Protocol
measure.description: Number of participants incurring additional costs during their compliance with prescribed hygiene measures prescribed with the decolonization regimen: e.g., cost of containers of lotion or bars of soap discarded, cost of new pump or pour lotion or soap purchased, cost of new personal hygiene items or linens, cost of additional loads of laundry
measure.population: 435 of 474 participants returned their cost of protocol documentation. This SECONDARY outcome is independent of study group, as the economic impact of the study in the overall study population is the outcome measure.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Reporting a Confirmed MRSA Infection Over the 12-month Longitudinal Study Period.
outcome.description: Number of participants reporting the development of a MRSA infection over the year of longitudinal follow-up that has been culture- and physician-confirmed through verification by medical record and culture report.
outcome.population: 416 of 474 participants were analyzed. The remaining 58 participants were lost to follow up for this time frame and outcome.

group.title: Individualized Approach
group.description: The decolonization regimen will be performed only by those household members who experienced SSTI in the prior year. 2% mupirocin ointment: Participants over 1 month of age, apply ointment to the anterior nares twice daily for 5 days. Bleach Bath (dilute): Participants over 1 month of age, pour 1/4 cup of bleach into a bath tub filled 1/4 full of water. Soak in bath for 15 minutes daily for 5 days. Hygiene Protocol: Follow key hygiene tips: Throw out all lotions or creams that you dip your hands into and replace with pumps or pour bottles. Use liquid(pour or pump) soaps instead of bar soaps. Wash hands frequently or use hand sanitizer(with more than %60 alcohol) such as Germ-X or Purell. Do not share personal care items such as razors, brushes, or deodorant. Wash all sheets and towels in hot water. Wash sheets every week. Use towels and wash cloths only once before washing and do not share.

group.description: All members of the household will perform the decolonization regimen. 2% mupirocin ointment: Participants over 1 month of age, apply ointment to the anterior nares twice daily for 5 days. Wash hands frequently or use hand sanitizer(with more than %60 alcohol) such as Germ-X or Purell. Do not share personal care items such as razors, brushes, or deodorant. Wash all sheets and towels in hot water. Wash sheets every week. Use towels and wash cloths only once before washing and do not share.

measure.title: Number of Participants Reporting a Confirmed MRSA Infection Over the 12-month Longitudinal Study Period.
measure.description: Number of participants reporting the development of a MRSA infection over the year of longitudinal follow-up that has been culture- and physician-confirmed through verification by medical record and culture report.
measure.population: 416 of 474 participants were analyzed. The remaining 58 participants were lost to follow up for this time frame and outcome.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: testing non-inferiority of individualized approach compared to household approach.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Adhering to Decolonization Measures
outcome.description: Number of participants Adhering to decolonization measures. Defined as reported completion of at least 4 of the 5 assigned days (8 or more mupirocin applications and 4 or more bleach baths)
outcome.population: 309 participants were assigned decolonization measures as part of the protocol. Of these 11 participants were lost to follow-up and never returned their adherence documents. The remaining 298 participants are analyzed.

group.title: Individualized Approach
group.description: The decolonization regimen will be performed only by those household members who experienced SSTI in the prior year. 2% mupirocin ointment: Participants over 1 month of age, apply ointment to the anterior nares twice daily for 5 days. Bleach Bath (dilute): Participants over 1 month of age, pour 1/4 cup of bleach into a bath tub filled 1/4 full of water. Soak in bath for 15 minutes daily for 5 days. Hygiene Protocol: Follow key hygiene tips: Throw out all lotions or creams that you dip your hands into and replace with pumps or pour bottles. Use liquid(pour or pump) soaps instead of bar soaps. Wash hands frequently or use hand sanitizer(with more than %60 alcohol) such as Germ-X or Purell. Do not share personal care items such as razors, brushes, or deodorant. Wash all sheets and towels in hot water. Wash sheets every week. Use towels and wash cloths only once before washing and do not share.

group.description: All members of the household will perform the decolonization regimen. 2% mupirocin ointment: Participants over 1 month of age, apply ointment to the anterior nares twice daily for 5 days. Bleach Bath (dilute): Participants over 1 month of age, pour 1/4 cup of bleach into a bath tub filled 1/4 full of water. Soak in bath for 15 minutes daily for 5 days. Hygiene Protocol: Follow key hygiene tips: Throw out all lotions or creams that you dip your hands into and replace with pumps or pour bottles. Use liquid(pour or pump) soaps instead of bar soaps. Wash hands frequently or use hand sanitizer(with more than %60 alcohol) such as Germ-X or Purell. Do not share personal care items such as razors, brushes, or deodorant. Wash all sheets and towels in hot water. Wash sheets every week. Use towels and wash cloths only once before washing and do not share.

measure.population: 309 participants were assigned decolonization measures as part of the protocol. Of these 11 participants were lost to follow-up and never returned their adherence documents. The remaining 298 participants are analyzed.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
